review:
I came to this game with no previous IRL programming language (I didnt even know what Linux commands were or how to use them lolol) but i saw Thor from PirateSoftware playing and talking about it and i enjoy learning so gave the game a try. (I am glad this game is a much simplified down version from what i researched though cuz from my readings there is a LOT more complexity to Unix commands that is still kinda mystifying to me at the moment lolol small progress is still progress is my go to lolol)

I HIGHLY recommend this game to anyone who doesn't have a programming/computer background (like me) who wants to be introduced to some new concepts to research and try to apply (This IS a game and I by no means think it is a 1 to 1 comparison to IRL, but for me it has helped give me a context to even learn how to ask the questions of myself to research, mostly through google and in game documentation lolol) a little of actual computer knowledge: see below for more in-depth info on an example of mine from when I first started (I am still SO new and as I learn bits of this or that in-game system it hints at a vastness of knowledge in the distance for me that can at times feel a little overwhelming but also exciting and fulfilling when I start seeing my research paying off in helping me understand what is needed to get into the NPC computer is hella fulfilling to me. 

This game hits SOOOOOOOOO many of my reward center chemical release buttons! llololol 

The 1st time i got into a NPC computer? WHOOOOO in my brain
the 1st time i was able to take and decrypt a bank acct? WHOOOOO
1st time i transferred all the money from a NPC to MY bank acct?? LOOT GOBLIN MODE ACTIVATED!!!! 

The community and a few people in particular for me have been a super helpful and inviting source of information, and there is almost always someone who can point me in the direction or give me a subtle hint on what I might want to explore learning about to get my problem solved if my solo researching isnt working or i feel stuck, so even as a new player with no background in computers I have felt able to process and learn the in game systems at least to a semi-functional state (I built my first in-game multi-tool script this morning after like DAYS spent trying things out! it lets me grab and decipher the npc's passwords and THEN it grabs their deciphered bank and mail passwords too! let's go! it's dinky and silly but i am excited! Big thank you to the main person in VC who was giving me invaluable bug hunting tips; never would have thought of those options if they hadn't mentioned it lolol) 

I think this game has been a wonderful way to give me new concepts in programming and computers that I would not have even known the question to ask if I was not playing this game and getting the game missions wherefor example I go, well I am lost on what a port 3306 is; so I googled up information on what is port for computer and learned a bunch about port # standardization, etc.... then I felt a huge amount of accomplishment (kinda silly but it IS true lolol) so then I could use the knowledge that 3306 port is SQL to use the in game shops to get a proper exploit, BAM got in to the npc computer!

this is a real example; I didnt know what ports are in a computer sense, MAY or may not have had the first thought of, hmmm that's weird why is this referencing ship ports? lolol) 

Will be looking forward to learning even more and playing this game for a metric a** ton of hours more, I now see why there are guides in the community from players with multiple THOUSANDS of hours lolol 

Looking forward to learning to a point where I feel proficient enough to join multiplayer, some of the things ive read in the Official discord and PirateSoft's channel for this game are crazy fun sounding lolol

review:
I found this game through Pirate Software's community and after watching some gameplay had to give it a try.

[b]Let's get to what everyone wants to know![/b]

Do I recommend people play this game?
Short Answer: Yes! Goblin approved! (Cannot smash that like button enough!)

Longer Answer: This game is the most complete hacking sim I have played so far. It does have a bit of a learning curve to it, but so does real life. You start with just a basic rig and your knowledge; no internet access, no fancy tools. I've spent plenty of hours in Single Player getting used to the games scripting/programming abilities and building tools useful to me. Even making my own improvements to tools already available in the game! I love that you can do this in Grey Hack! This means the game can evolve with the player base but it also means you will want to stay alert! While you are developing tools to gain access to other systems, so is the rest of the community. If this is your jam then you need to get Grey Hack.

Summary:
This game is still in development but its progess and accuracy so far is scary with a single developer. Yes, ONE PERSON is developing Grey Hack. I tip my hat to you, keep up the AMAZING work!

review:
[b]This game is not for beginners![/b]

[i]That being said. . .[/i]

I recommend this game to beginners.

There is basically no tutorial and if you want to succeed in this game, you need to watch Youtube videos about not only this game, but IT and infosec. 

I finally complete the first mission after the tutorial after [i]13 hours[/i]
I somehow managed  to get a mission involving a firewall and a computer with no open ports on a level 0 mission.
So, I learned.

In summation, in order to enjoy this game, you need to learn on your own about programming/IT/Networks/Infosec and it would really help to join a community.
